net.opentsdb.uid

Class RandomUniqueId

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.opentsdb.uid.RandomUniqueId

  • public class RandomUniqueId
extends Object
    Generate Random UIDs to be used as unique ID. Random metric IDs help to distribute hotspots evenly to region servers. It is better to decide whether to use random or serial uid for one type when the hbase uid table is empty. If the logic to switch between random or serial uid is changed in between writes it will cause frequent id collisions.
    Since:
    2.2

    • Method Detail

      • getRandomUID

        public static long getRandomUID()
        Get the next random metric UID, a positive integer greater than zero. The default metric ID width is 3 bytes. If it is 3 then it can return only up to the max value a 3 byte integer can return, which is 2^31-1. In that case, even though it is long, its range will be between 0 and 2^31-1. NOTE: The caller is responsible for assuring that the UID hasn't been assigned yet.
        Returns:
        a random UID up to TSDB.metrics_width() wide

      • getRandomUID

        public static long getRandomUID(int width)
        Get the next random UID. It creates random bytes, then convert it to an unsigned long.
        Parameters:
        width - Number of bytes to randomize, it can not be larger than MAX_WIDTH bytes wide
        Returns:
        a randomly UID
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the width is larger than MAX_WIDTH bytes
